ygData.subject: Re: Down the rabbit hole (Tuscon & Rodimus)

Tucson Prime continues on his path, and keeps at a good but safe speed thro=
ugh the tunnel.  He knew that going too fast could upset the structure even=
 weaken it to the point of breaking, which he did not want to do.  He conti=
nues steadilly, sensing that Vestige was growing weak once more.  Gently, h=
e begins to take control of his own wheel, and goes in the direction of whe=
re he's being led.

"It's all right old friend, you have given me the cours=
e, I can take it from here.  Rest now.  I promise we will reach the chamber=
 in time for you to be repaired."

With each word Tucson speaks, his voice =
changes ever so slightly, sounding more and more like Optimus Prime. Still =
he himself has no idea that he was ever related to the great Autobot leader=
.  All he knew is that he admired him greatly not only as his commander, bu=
t as a mentor during his younger years as a rookie Autobot.  Tucson could n=
ow sense some changes within himself, not only on the outside, but on the i=
nside as well.  He could have turned to fight whatever onslaught was follow=
ing him, yet he chose not to, and chose to save a life over taking one.  It=
 was a choice he felt very good about and had no regrets to his decision.  =


--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:=

>
> > <OLD>
> >
> > Tucson did not wish to wear Vestige out. Now that he w=
as safely on his feet, he could transform into his vehicle mode and does so=
 readilly, gently opening his driver's side door for Vestige, and lowering =
his left wheels down to where the old Autobot could get into him easier.
> =
>
> > " If you ask me, I think we'll get there a lot sooner of I take to th=
e wheels instead of my feet. You can drive me to where we need to go, I don=
't mind. And sometimes, trust just comes from the heart. And a heart that t=
rusts, is a heart that's compassionate, and a heart that feels compassion i=
s one that has true power. Nothing can overpower that, nothing. That's what=
 I keep telling everyone back at Autobot Headquarters. It doesn't matter if=
 you have powerful weapons, if you don't have what truely matters, then you=
 have hardly anything at all. You have more than that to go around old frie=
nd, I can feel it. Now, let's get you to your repair chamber. Oh, if you fe=
el weak, just let me know and I'll take over."
> >
> > He waits for Vestige=
 to get in.
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> Vestige spryly lept into the seat inside Tuscon=
's cab. He closed the
> door and took a moment to look around, glancing at =
the different
> controls that Tuscon had. "You look like something I have s=
een before,
> but I can't place where." Vestige look confused for a moment,=
 as his
> voice trailed off thoughtfully.
> 
> After a moment he shook it o=
ff. "We have to go that way." he said
> pointing down the hall. The hall ha=
d gotten a little darker, as if the
> lights had been turned down a notch o=
r two, but the way ahead was
> still clearly visable.
> 
> Vestige lay a ha=
nd on Tuscon's steering wheel as he placed a foot on
> his accelerator, "I =
don't know how much more time we have . . . I . .
> I . . have, so we have =
to go." Vestige's voice was already getting a
> little shaky, but he swallo=
wed it as he tried to engage Tuscon's
> engines to start them moving.
> 
> =
Outside the vehicle the lights continued to slowly dim and the
> scraping n=
oises were getting louder and more insistant. It began to
> sound like meta=
l blades sliding along steel shelled amor and in the
> background, almost i=
mperceptable at first a slight hum could be just
> bearly heard - where it =
was coming from was difficult to tell.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
